title: Drawing, before 1776
medium: Pen and black and brown ink, brush and light brownwash, rose colored watercolor on white laid paper, mounted blue green board with gold ruled lines
creditline: Museum purchase from Friends of Drawings and Prints Fund
description: Theater design for a dining room of a lower floor and balcony. Lower floor contains 4 ornate corinthain columns with drapes hanging between them, 2 sculptures on either side, a chandelier and a fireplace. Balcony contains columns with caryatids, hanging drapes, and 5 chandeliers.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, before 1776.
before 1776. Pen and black and brown ink, brush and light brownwash, rose colored watercolor on white laid paper, mounted blue green board with gold ruled lines. Museum purchase from Friends of Drawings and Prints Fund. 1975-42-1.
